uk.ac.susx.mlcl.lib.events
Interface ProgressReporting

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCopyCommand, AbstractExternalSortCommand, AbstractSortCommand, CountTask, ExternalCountCommand, ExternalKnnSimsCommand, ExternalSortEntriesCommand, ExternalSortEventsCommand, ExternalSortInstancesCommand, FileCopyTask, FileDeleteTask, FileMoveTask, FilterCommand, IndexingCommands, IndexingCommands.IndexEntries, IndexingCommands.IndexEvents, IndexingCommands.IndexFeatures, IndexingCommands.IndexInstances, IndexingCommands.IndexNeighbours, IndexingCommands.IndexSims, IndexingCommands.UnindexEntries, IndexingCommands.UnindexEvents, IndexingCommands.UnindexFeatures, IndexingCommands.UnindexInstances, IndexingCommands.UnindexNeighbours, IndexingCommands.UnindexSims, InvertedApssTask, KnnSimsCommand, NaiveApssTask, ObjectMergeTask, ObjectPipeTask, ObjectSortTask, ProgressAggregate, ProgressDelegate, SortEntriesCommand, SortEventsCommand, SortInstancesCommand, ThreadedApssTask
public interface ProgressReporting

Defines a common interface for tasks which can report their progress as a percentage completed.

Author:
Hamish Morgan <hamish.morgan@sussex.ac.uk>

Nested Class Summary
static class ProgressReporting.State
          States that this progress reported can be in.

Method Detail

getName

String getName()
A string identifier for this progress reporter, that can be used by progress reports.

Returns:
human readable identifier

getProgressPercent

int getProgressPercent()
Accessor to the operations progress towards completion as a percentage.

Returns:
percentage completed as an integer in the interval [0,100]
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - when unsupported

isProgressPercentageSupported

boolean isProgressPercentageSupported()
Whether or not the ProgressReporting implementation supports progress reporting as a percentage towards completion. Not all ProgressReporting tasks can estimate the total progress towards completion, for example because the task operates on a data stream of unknown length. In this case the implementation should return false.

Returns:
true if progress percentage, false otherwise.

getState

ProgressReporting.State getState()
Accessor to the state of this progress reporter. (As defined in ProgressReporting.State.)

Returns:
the state

getProgressReport

String getProgressReport()
Returns:
a human-readable string representing the current progress

addProgressListener

void addProgressListener(ProgressListener progressListener)
Attach a ProgressListener that will be notified when the progress changes (presumably when it increases). If the given progress listener is already attached then nothing will change.

Parameters:
progressListener - listener to be notified of progress changes

removeProgressListener

void removeProgressListener(ProgressListener progressListener)
Detach a ProgressListener from receiving progress change events. If the listener is not already attached then nothing happens.

Parameters:
progressListener - listener to be removed

getProgressListeners

ProgressListener[] getProgressListeners()
Returns:
array of currently attached listeners.
